Title.evidence: Hemodynamic Characteristics of Type II Endoleaks: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised into two groups

Intervention.evidence: randomised into two groups: 20 patients with type II endoleaks identified within 1 week after endovascular aortic repair (EVAR) and 25 patients with persistent type II endoleaks diagnosed during follow-up imaging

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to investigate the hemodynamic characteristics of type II endoleaks

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the consistency between simulation results and clinical time-enhanced curves (TECs) from 4D-CT

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed

Number_Randomised.evidence: 45 participants at a single center between April 2017 and April 2022

Result_Outcome.evidence: Significant differences in TEC parameters were observed between stable and enlarged groups, with 80% enhancement duration (AUC, 0.88), peak-to-peak time feeder (AUC, 0.78), and upslope (AUC, 0.86) being most informative
